div.bibl: Daily Jewish Courier, October 29, 1912. WORKERS GHETTO.

body.p: A union of the following trades was organized for the first time in Chicago. It comprised the ladies waist workers, dresses, white goods, kimonos, petticoats, and children dresses.

This occurred last Thursday evening at a huge mass meeting of workers of these trades. Many responded to the speakers declarations that the sole way to better their condition was through uniting into a union. They paid their admission fee and organized the Ladies Waist and Underwear Union, in affiliation with the International Ladies Garment Workers.

The installation of officers will take place, Friday evening, in the Palace Opera Building, Blue Island Avenue at 12th Street, in Hall B, second floor. At this meeting a charter will be given to the Union and election of officers will take place.
